title: Heavy rainfall above 100mm expected today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at most places of the island during the afternoon or night today (04).

title: Family of Sri Lankan woman who died in Japan detention demand release of full footage
byline: The family of a Sri Lankan woman who died in a detention centre in Japan in 2021 is planning to file a lawsuit to demand that Japanese authorities release hundreds of hours of security footage of her last days to help determine the cause of her death.

title: Local renewable energy developers face unfair terms compared to foreign investors – Energy Analysts
byline: Energy Analyst Dr. Vidhura Ralapanawe says Sri Lanka’s local energy developers are being offered unfavourable terms for renewable energy projects compared to foreign investors.

title: Indian Prime Minister Modi to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to arrive in Sri Lanka today (04) for a three-day state visit, marking a significant diplomatic engagement between the two nations.

title: Three women arrested in connection with house burglary in Moratuwa
byline: Police have arrested three women in connection with a burglary that took place in the Moratuwa Police Division, during which over Rs. 600,000 in cash was reportedly stolen.

title: Unanimous decision by South Korea’s Constitutional Court to oust President Yoon
byline: South Korea’s Constitutional Court on Friday (Apr 4) decided to oust President Yoon Suk Yeol, upholding parliament’s impeachment motion over his short-lived imposition of martial law last year that sparked the country’s worst political crisis in decades.

title: Election Commission bans relief food package distribution for festive season
byline: The Election Commission has temporarily suspended the government’s New Year food relief program, citing concerns over its implementation ahead of the upcoming local government elections.

title: Indictments served on Yoshitha and his grandmother
byline: Indictments have been served before the Colombo High Court on Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his grandmother Daisy Forest.

title: Harsha urges govt to provide relief to exporters amidst US tariffs
byline: The government must provide urgent relief to exporters on the backdrop of the reciprocal tariffs imposed by United States President Donald Trump, according to the Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance, Parliamentarian Harsha de Silva.

title: LG Polls: Appeals Court orders to re-accept rejected nomination papers
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the relevant Returning Officers to re-accept nearly 37 rejected nomination papers submitted by candidates to contest for several Local Government (LG) institutions across the island.

title: Five major changes coming to iPhone 17 in 2025
byline: Apple’s next iPhone is expected to be a significant upgrade over more than six generations, bringing a design overhaul. Reports are rife that the iPhone 17 will feature a new camera design, thinner and smoother displays, and better software capabilities for photography, navigation, and artificial intelligence.

title: EC to educate police officers on election laws ahead of LG Polls
byline: The National Election Commission has decided to educate the police officers pertaining to the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Act and the Regulation of Election Expenditure Act ahead of the impending Local Government Elections.

title: IUSF Convenor granted bail
byline: The Convenor of the Inter-University Students’ Federation (IUSF) Madushan Chandrajith and another individual who were arrested and remanded for staging a protest in defiance of a court order have been granted bail, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Seven teenagers arrested over gang sexual assault on 15-year-old girl
byline: Police have arrested a student, alleged to be the boyfriend of a 15-year-old schoolgirl, and six other suspects including four schoolboys in connection with the gang sexual assault on the teenage girl in question.

title: Passenger arrested with mobile phones worth over Rs. 100 mln at BIA
byline: A 32-year-old individual from Kattankudy in Batticaloa was arrested this morning (04) by the officers of Sri Lanka Customs at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for attempting to smuggle a stock of high-end mobile phones valued at over Rs. 100 million into the country.

title: Maximum retail prices for bottled water
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has issued an Extraordinary Gazette notification setting the maximum retail prices for locally bottled drinking water, effective from April 01.

title: PM holds talks to improve ties with Bhutan and Nepal
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has held discussions with Premiers of Bhutan and Nepal, focusing on enhancing collaboration in areas of mutual interest, including economic cooperation and regional connectivity.

title: Special traffic plans in place as Indian PM Modi visits Sri Lanka today
byline: Security authorities have implemented a series of special traffic arrangements to ensure security and minimize public inconvenience, as Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today.

title: Inmate murdered inside Boossa High-Security Prison
byline: An inmate, who was under remand custody at the Boossa High-Security Prison, has reportedly been murdered inside the prison premises.

title: ‘Relations between Sri Lanka and India have never been stronger’: envoy
byline: Relations between Sri Lanka and India have never been stronger, according to the Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Santosh Jha.

title: 2012 Greek bonds case against ex-CBSL Governor Cabraal moved to June
byline: The Colombo High Court has fixed the pre-trial conference pertaining to the case filed by Bribery Commission against former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal and a group of defendants on June 26, 2025.

title: Immigration Controller General’s bail application rejected
byline: The bail application filed on behalf of the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, Harsha Illukpitiya who is currently in remand custody for contempt of court, has been rejected by the Supreme Court.

title: LG Polls:  59 petitions against rejection of nomination papers dismissed
byline: The Supreme Court has rejected 53 writ petitions and six fundamental rights petitions filed by political parties challenging the rejection of their nomination papers submitted for the 2025 local government elections, without taking them into consideration.

title: US stocks post biggest drop since 2020, dollar falls as Trump tariffs fuel recession fears
byline: Major U.S. stock indexes registered their biggest daily percentage drops since 2020 on Thursday and the dollar weakened as U.S. President Donald Trump’s drastic trade tariffs stoked fears of a global recession and led investors to seek safe-haven assets like bonds and the yen.

title: China to impose 34% retaliatory tariff on all goods imported from US
byline: China on Friday announced a slew of additional tariffs and restrictions against U.S. goods as a countermeasure to sweeping tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Govt incurred Rs. 2.4 billion loss due to permits issued to import electric vehicles, COPA uncovers
byline: A significant misuse has occurred in issuing permits for the importation of fully electric vehicles to Sri Lankans employed abroad, based on foreign remittances, the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has revealed.

title: No changes to LG Polls date, Elections Chief insists
byline: The 2025 Local Government Elections will be held as scheduled on May 6, according to the Chairman of the National Election Commission R.M.A.L. Rathnayake.

title: President vows to ensure fair prices for farmers and consumers for agri produce
byline: The National New Paddy Harvest Festival (Aluth Sahal Mangalya), a traditional annual ceremony of offering the first portion of the freshly harvested Maha season paddy to the sacred Sri Maha Bodhi, was held this morning (04) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the historic Sri Maha Bodhi premises in Anuradhapura.

title: Oil tumbles 8% as China retaliates with tariffs on US
byline: Oil prices plunged by 8% on Friday, heading for their lowest close since the midst of the coronavirus pandemic in 2021, as China hit back in an escalating global trade war with the U.S. after President Donald Trump’s barrage of levies this week.

title: National Police Commission cancels transfer of Bingiriya OIC
byline: The National Police Commission has cancelled the transfer of the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Bingiriya Police Station by the Acting IGP, with immediate effect.

title: Indian PM Narendra Modi arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi has arrived in the island this evening on a historical three-day state visit.

title: One person injured in shooting at Elpitiya
byline: One person has reportedly been injured in a shooting incident in the Beligaswella area of Uragasmanhandiya, Elpitiya.

title: Sri Lanka ready to engage with US in strengthening trade relations - Finance Ministry
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka says it stands ready to engage with the US administration at the earliest opportunity to explore ways to manage the trade balance in a fair manner and that it is committed to substantially reducing tariff and non-tariff barriers that hinder trade and investment.
